title: ISic000986. Funerary inscription of Auxanon
body:
1ivy-leaf alpha ⳨ omega ivy-leaf
2τοίμβος Σα-
3βίνου ἐν αὐτῷ
4κῖτε Αὐξάνων
5ὁ τούτου υἱὸς
6βιώσας ἔτη κε´
7⸙

l.2 reg., orig. τοίμβος

1ivy-leafalpha⳨omegaivy-leaf
2ΤΟΙΜΒΟΣΣΑ
3ΒΙΝΟΥΕΝΑΥΤΩ
4ΚΙΤΕΑΥΞΑΝΩΝ
5ΟΤΟΥΤΟΥΥΙΟΣ
6ΒΙΩΣΑΣΕΤΗΚΕ
7

l.2 reg., orig. τοίμβος

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • text as per Crispi, Kaibel in IG, Orsi (Kaibel omits the second hedera in line 1)

English translation

Jonathan Prag

Tomb of Sabinos, in this lies Auxanon, son of this man, having lived 25 years

commentary

One of several inscriptions described by Crispi as coming from Taormina but commonly attributed to Siracusa.

bibliography

  • Crispi 1823 264 no.5 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002230
  • 14.0166 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001072
  • 4.9466 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001252
  • Orsi 2018 Tacc. 2, p.9 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002617
  • Rizzo 1904 116 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10003144
  • Strazzulla 1897 no. 107 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001390
  • Wessel 1989 49 no.188 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000394
  • Muscolino 2011-2012 234 G22 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002215
  • Ferrua 1989 no. 481 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001995
